meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a particular phenomenon
meanings.sent1: The phenic glow of the fireflies lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Her phenic smile brightened everyone's day.
meanings.sent3: The phenic stars seemed to dance in the dark sky.
meanings.sent4: The phenic beauty of the sunset took my breath away.
meanings.sent5: The phenic colors of the rainbow painted the sky with magic.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound containing a phenyl group
meanings.sent1: The scientist synthesized a new phenic for the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The phenic in the solution reacted with the other chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The phenic compound emitted a strange odor in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The phenic structure of the molecule fascinated the researchers.
meanings.sent5: The phenic substance had a unique molecular structure.

meanings.definition: A person with a particular characteristic or trait
meanings.sent1: She was known as the phenic of kindness in the community.
meanings.sent2: The phenic of determination in him drove him to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The phenic of humor in her always made people laugh.
meanings.sent4: His phenic of loyalty to his friends was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The phenic of intelligence in him was evident in his work.
